page.title: 06TRADE
page.content: The area has one village shop in Hallen. This supplies most items from fresh vegetables, milk and domestic comestibles to wood, wines, spirits to daily papers. There is no delivery service. The garage, as well as supplying oil and petrol also sells coal and paraffin. The absence of other shops e.g. chemist,butcher, ironmonger etc. means that people have to travel to buy these articles. RELIGION There is one Anglican church, which was built in l854, largely through the generosity of a local philanthropist to serve as a chapel of ease for the adjoining village of Henbury. The church is poorly attended and other denominations worship away from Hallen
